greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime greater than n-th prime having as many ones in binary representation.
comment: If A000040(6543)=A019434(5)=65537 is the last Fermat prime, the sequence is finite with last term a(6542)=73471.
link: R. Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..6542
mathematica: sp1b[n_]:=Module[{o=DigitCount[n,2,1],p=NextPrime[n]},While[ DigitCount[ p,2,1]!=o,p = NextPrime[ p]];p]; sp1b/@Prime[Range[2,60]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, May 02 2019 *)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 07 2010
